00007 CellQuality::CellQuality() {

00010 
00011 CellQuality::CellQuality( const int id, const int status ) {
00012   _obj->setIntVal( 0, id );
00013   setStatus( status );
00014 }
00015 
00016 // The setting of the status is needed at several places in the class.
00017 // To avoid duplicatind the information that status is int number 1 in the _obj
00018 // this helper function is introduced. It is private and for internal use only.
00019 void CellQuality::setStatus(int status)
00020 {
00021   _obj->setIntVal( 1, status );
00022 }
00023

00025   UTIL::LCFixedObject< 2, 0, 0 >( o ) { }

00032 const int CellQuality::getCellID() const {
00033   return _obj->getIntVal( 0 );
00034 }
00035 
00036 const int CellQuality::getStatus() const {
00037   return _obj->getIntVal( 1 );
00038 }

00041 const std::string CellQuality::getTypeName() const {
00042   return "CellQuality";
00043 }

00046 const std::string CellQuality::getDataDescription() const {
00047   return "i:ID, i:status";
00048 }
00049 
00050 bool CellQuality::isDead() const {
00051   return ( getStatus() & _dead );
00052 }
00053 
00054 bool CellQuality::isNoisy() const {
00055   return ( getStatus() & _noisy );
00056 }
00057 
00058 void CellQuality::setDead( bool dead )
00059 {
00060   if (dead)
00061   {
00062     // Set the dead bit.
00063     // Apply a bitwise OR which turns on this bit and leaves the others unchanged.
00064     setStatus( getStatus() | _dead );
00065   }
00066   else
00067   {
00068     // Delete the dead bit.
00069     // This is done by inverting the _dead mask, where all bits are set
00070     // except for the dead bit. Applying a bitwise AND will leave all 
00071     // bits unchanged except for the dead bit.
00072     setStatus( getStatus() & ~_dead );
00073   }
00074 
00075 }
00076 
00077 void CellQuality::setNoisy( bool noisy )
00078 {
00079   // for docu see setDead
00080   if (noisy)
00081   {
00082     setStatus( getStatus() | _noisy );
00083   }
00084   else
00085   {
00086     setStatus( getStatus() & ~_noisy );
00087   }
00088 }
00089 
00090 } // namespace CALICE
